00044 // Symbol
00045 
00046 Symbol::Symbol(const std::string &n, SourcePos p, const Type *t) 
00047   : pos(p), name(n) {
00048     storagePtr = NULL;
00049     function = NULL;
00050     type = t;
00051     constValue = NULL;
00052     isStatic = false;
00053     varyingCFDepth = 0;
00054 }

00056 
00057 std::string
00058 Symbol::MangledName() const {
00059     return name + type->Mangle();
00060 }

00062 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00063 // SymbolTable
00064 
00065 SymbolTable::SymbolTable() {
00066     PushScope();
00067 }
00068 
00069 
00070 SymbolTable::~SymbolTable() {
00071     // Otherwise we have mismatched push/pop scopes
00072     assert(variables.size() == 1 && types.size() == 1);
00073     PopScope();
00074 }
00075 
00076 void
00077 SymbolTable::PushScope() { 
00078     variables.push_back(new std::vector<Symbol *>); 
00079     types.push_back(new TypeMapType);
00080 }
00081 
00082 
00083 void
00084 SymbolTable::PopScope() { 
00085     // FIXME: delete Symbols in variables vector<>...
00086     assert(variables.size() > 1);
00087     delete variables.back();
00088     variables.pop_back();
00089     assert(types.size() > 1);
00090     delete types.back();
00091     types.pop_back();
00092 }
00093 
00094 
00095 bool
00096 SymbolTable::AddVariable(Symbol *symbol) {
00097     assert(symbol != NULL);
00098 
00099     // Check to see if a symbol of the same name has already been declared.
00100     for (int i = (int)variables.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
00101         std::vector<Symbol *> &sv = *(variables[i]);
00102         for (int j = (int)sv.size() - 1; j >= 0; --j) {
00103             if (sv[j]->name == symbol->name) {
00104                 if (i == (int)variables.size()-1) {
00105                     // If a symbol of the same name was declared in the
00106                     // same scope, it's an error.
00107                     Error(symbol->pos, "Ignoring redeclaration of symbol \"%s\".", 
00108                           symbol->name.c_str());
00109                     return false;
00110                 }
00111                 else {
00112                     // Otherwise it's just shadowing something else, which
00113                     // is legal but dangerous..
00114                     Warning(symbol->pos, 
00115                             "Symbol \"%s\" shadows symbol declared in outer scope.",
00116                             symbol->name.c_str());
00117                     variables.back()->push_back(symbol);
00118                     return true;
00119                 }
00120             }
00121         }
00122     }
00123 
00124     // No matches, so go ahead and add it...
00125     variables.back()->push_back(symbol);
00126     return true;
00127 }
00128 
00129 
00130 Symbol *
00131 SymbolTable::LookupVariable(const char *name) {
00132     // Note that we iterate through the variables vectors backwards, sinec
00133     // we want to search from the innermost scope to the outermost, so that
00134     // we get the right symbol if we have multiple variables in different
00135     // scopes that shadow each other.
00136     std::vector<std::vector<Symbol *> *>::reverse_iterator liter = variables.rbegin();
00137     while (liter != variables.rend()) {
00138         std::vector<Symbol *> &sv = *(*liter);
00139         for (int i = (int)sv.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i)
00140             if (sv[i]->name == name) 
00141                 return sv[i];
00142         ++liter;
00143     }
00144     return NULL;
00145 }
00146 
00147 
00148 bool
00149 SymbolTable::AddFunction(Symbol *symbol) {
00150     const FunctionType *ft = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(symbol->type);
00151     assert(ft != NULL);
00152     if (LookupFunction(symbol->name.c_str(), ft) != NULL)
00153         // A function of the same name and type has already been added to
00154         // the symbol table
00155         return false;
00156 
00157     functions[symbol->name].push_back(symbol);
00158     return true;
00159 }
00160 
00161 
00162 std::vector<Symbol *> *
00163 SymbolTable::LookupFunction(const char *name) {
00164     if (functions.find(name) != functions.end())
00165         return &functions[name];
00166     return NULL;
00167 }
00168 
00169 
00170 Symbol *
00171 SymbolTable::LookupFunction(const char *name, const FunctionType *type) {
00172     if (functions.find(name) == functions.end())
00173         return NULL;
00174 
00175     std::vector<Symbol *> &funcs = functions[name];
00176     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < funcs.size(); ++i)
00177         if (Type::Equal(funcs[i]->type, type))
00178             return funcs[i];
00179     return NULL;
00180 }
00181 
00182 
00183 bool
00184 SymbolTable::AddType(const char *name, const Type *type, SourcePos pos) {
00185     // Like AddVariable(), we go backwards through the type maps, working
00186     // from innermost scope to outermost.
00187     for (int i = types.size()-1; i >= 0; --i) {
00188         TypeMapType &sm = *(types[i]);
00189         if (sm.find(name) != sm.end()) {
00190             if (i == (int)types.size() - 1) {
00191                 Error(pos, "Ignoring redefinition of type \"%s\".", name);
00192                 return false;
00193             }
00194             else {
00195                 Warning(pos, "Type \"%s\" shadows type declared in outer scope.", name);
00196                 TypeMapType &sm = *(types.back());
00197                 sm[name] = type;
00198                 return true;
00199             }
00200         }
00201     }
00202 
00203     TypeMapType &sm = *(types.back());
00204     sm[name] = type;
00205     return true;
00206 }
00207 
00208 
00209 const Type *
00210 SymbolTable::LookupType(const char *name) const {
00211     // Again, search through the type maps backward to get scoping right.
00212     for (int i = types.size()-1; i >= 0; --i) {
00213         TypeMapType &sm = *(types[i]);
00214         if (sm.find(name) != sm.end())
00215             return sm[name];
00216     }
00217     return NULL;
00218 }

00221 std::vector<std::string>
00222 SymbolTable::ClosestVariableOrFunctionMatch(const char *str) const {
00223     // This is a little wasteful, but we'll look through all of the
00224     // variable and function symbols and compute the edit distance from the
00225     // given string to them.  If the edit distance is under maxDelta, then
00226     // it goes in the entry of the matches[] array corresponding to its
00227     // edit distance.
00228     const int maxDelta = 2;
00229     std::vector<std::string> matches[maxDelta+1];
00230 
00231     for (int i = 0; i < (int)variables.size(); ++i) {
00232         std::vector<Symbol *> &sv = *(variables[i]);
00233         for (int j = 0; j < (int)sv.size(); ++j) {
00234             int dist = StringEditDistance(str, sv[j]->name, maxDelta+1);
00235             if (dist <= maxDelta)
00236                 matches[dist].push_back(sv[j]->name);
00237         }
00238     }
00239 
00240     std::map<std::string, std::vector<Symbol *> >::const_iterator iter;
00241     for (iter = functions.begin(); iter != functions.end(); ++iter) {
00242         int dist = StringEditDistance(str, iter->first, maxDelta+1);
00243             if (dist <= maxDelta)
00244                 matches[dist].push_back(iter->first);
00245     }
00246 
00247     // Now, return the first entry of matches[] that is non-empty, if any.
00248     for (int i = 0; i <= maxDelta; ++i) {
00249         if (matches[i].size())
00250             return matches[i];
00251     }
00252 
00253     // Otherwise, no joy.
00254     return std::vector<std::string>();
00255 }
00256 
00257 
00258 std::vector<std::string>
00259 SymbolTable::ClosestTypeMatch(const char *str) const {
00260     // This follows the same approach as ClosestVariableOrFunctionmatch()
00261     // above; compute all edit distances, keep the ones shorter than
00262     // maxDelta, return the first non-empty vector of one or more sets of
00263     // alternatives with minimal edit distance.
00264     const int maxDelta = 2;
00265     std::vector<std::string> matches[maxDelta+1];
00266 
00267     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < types.size(); ++i) {
00268         TypeMapType::const_iterator iter;
00269         for (iter = types[i]->begin(); iter != types[i]->end(); ++iter) {
00270             int dist = StringEditDistance(str, iter->first, maxDelta+1);
00271             if (dist <= maxDelta)
00272                 matches[dist].push_back(iter->first);
00273         }
00274     }
00275 
00276     for (int i = 0; i <= maxDelta; ++i) {
00277         if (matches[i].size())
00278             return matches[i];
00279     }
00280     return std::vector<std::string>();
00281 }

00283 
00284 void
00285 SymbolTable::Print() {
00286     int depth = 0;
00287     fprintf(stderr, "Variables:\n----------------\n");
00288     std::vector<std::vector<Symbol *> *>::iterator liter = variables.begin();
00289     while (liter != variables.end()) {
00290         fprintf(stderr, "%*c", depth, ' ');
00291         std::vector<Symbol *>::iterator siter = (*liter)->begin();
00292         while (siter != (*liter)->end()) {
00293             fprintf(stderr, "%s [%s]", (*siter)->name.c_str(), 
00294                     (*siter)->type->GetString().c_str());
00295             ++siter;
00296         }
00297         ++liter;
00298         fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00299         depth += 4;
00300     }
00301 
00302     fprintf(stderr, "Functions:\n----------------\n");
00303     std::map<std::string, std::vector<Symbol *> >::iterator fiter;
00304     fiter = functions.begin();
00305     while (fiter != functions.end()) {
00306         fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", fiter->first.c_str());
00307         std::vector<Symbol *> &syms = fiter->second;
00308         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < syms.size(); ++i)
00309             fprintf(stderr, "    %s\n", syms[i]->type->GetString().c_str());
00310         ++fiter;
00311     }
00312 
00313     depth = 0;
00314     fprintf(stderr, "Named types:\n---------------\n");
00315     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < types.size(); ++i) {
00316         TypeMapType &sm = *types[i];
00317         TypeMapType::iterator siter = sm.begin();
00318         while (siter != sm.end()) {
00319             fprintf(stderr, "%*c", depth, ' ');
00320             fprintf(stderr, "%s -> %s\n", siter->first.c_str(),
00321                     siter->second->GetString().c_str());
00322             ++siter;
00323         }
00324         depth += 4;
00325     }
00326 }
